message.body: I have another quick fcpx q - do people just sync audio and then export new qts for fcp7?
I did for awhile but it was mixing down my sound
I had like 4 channels and they were all mixed into one
Which was a bummer cause I had lavs, a boom and a scratch
oh and there's not a setting to keep them separate? editing a documentary and the guy is syncing the sound for me first in X
I couldn't find one if there was tonight looked for a little while but if you find one let me know because I still have to sink moor sound
well I don't have X and haven't ever even looked at it but there's a setting in fcp7 to have separate channels
It was great for syncing one truck though
So usually I would just find the best tracks to sink
that's annoying
whatever I just want his guy to sync for me
*this
but he should just export prores qts?
But sometimes the editor wanted to use ambience to cover cuts and we would have to go back and find that track and import

Yeah! That part was pretty seamless and fast. I just kept a new folder called synced files that were named the same as the originals just in case we needed to go back and find the original. Lots of logging
But it helped
ok well hopefully I can get him to do all that
I guess it doesn't retain time code?
hm. I'm so annoyed by all of this
I think it has the ability to do that but I didn't
well I told him to give me synced qts and a list of shots in order with time code
so hard to give people rates!
Yeah it's of time of work either way
Ton
Will that will be a huge help if he does that!
yeah I hope it works out. how are you?? we should all soon
talk
yes! when's good for you?
I'm good about to go see my mom for a few days! Let's catch up before I leave Friday!
Tmw! I'll call you tmw will you be around?
yes tmrw's good before 5, 6 your time?
Perfect!! I'll check with you in the afternoon
great!
Yay can't wait
me too!
